item.title: Four different street lights not working on Prince Regent Avenue, 13th January
item.description:
Street lights permanently not working on Prince Regent Avenue, light numbers: 2, 5, 9 and 11. They haven't worked for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Regent Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Give Way sign light permanently not working, 13th January
item.description:
Next to Prince of Wales Stadium as you turn off Tommy Taylors lane onto Prince Regent Avenue- Give Way sign light is permanently off. You cannot see the road turn off from Tommy Taylors Lane at night. The issue has been present for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Regent Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes larger half a meter wide and 10 inches deep causing damage to vehicles. Unavoidable as located in the middle of the road. Requires urgent repairs. Toad looks like it subsiding., 13th January

Between the railway bridge and the farm at the end

item.title: Blocked gulley, road flooded, 13th January
item.description:
Despite logging this previously, the Council deem it is now fixed and the complaint closed? Absolutely shocking, when the road has been flooded now for nearly 2 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
